data.title: BS in Accountancy
data.meta_description: BS in Accountancy  is a course offered by University Of Caloocan City. Click here to read more information about the course.
data.text:
About this course

The Bachelor of Science in Accountancy (BSA) program is a five-year program focused on subjects in financial, public, and managerial accounting, auditing, administration, business 164:Teaching & Academics:Laws, and taxation. The program also teaches students to integrate information technology concepts into business systems, to create a more systematic and organized way of storing business-related data. Aside from business topics, BSA also equips students with a basic understanding of computer programming and auditing systems.

Things You Might Need for this Course

Freshman Admission Requirements:

Admission Requirements - Freshmen: General Requirements: 1. Registered voter of Caloocan City or child of a registered voter of Caloocan City (bring Voter's ID, Voter's registration record, and original NSO Birth Certificate) 2. Child of a real property tax payer or sole proprietor tax payer of Caloocan City (bring latest tax declaration and receipts/Mayor's permit) or 3. Graduate of Elementary and/or high school in Caloocan City (bring Original Diploma) Documentary Requirements: Photocopies of the following documents (sealed in a long brown envelope) 1. Diploma of Completion (Senior High School) 2. General weighted average of 81 or better for the latest grading applicable as reflected in the original F-138/grade report card 3. 4pcs 2x2" ID Photos 4. P100 Exam Fee 5. NSO Birth Certificate Note: Bring an original copy for AUTHENTICATION purposes only.

Transferees Admission Requirements:

Admission Requirements - Transferees: General Requirements: 1. Registered voter of Caloocan City or child of a registered voter of Caloocan City (bring Voter's ID, Voter's registration record, and original NSO Birth Certificate) 2. Child of a real property tax payer or sole proprietor tax payer of Caloocan City (bring latest tax declaration and receipts/Mayor's permit) or 3. Graduate of Elementary and/or high school in Caloocan City (bring Original Diploma) Documentary Requirements: Photocopies of the following documents (sealed in a long brown envelope) 1. Transcript of records from previous university/college 2. General weighted average of 2.5 or better for the latest completed semester and must have passed 80% of enrolled subjects 3. Certificate of Good Moral Character 4. Certificate of Honorable Dismissal 5. 4pcs 2x2" ID Photos 5. P100 Exam Fee 6. NSO Birth Certificate Note: Bring an original copy for AUTHENTICATION purposes only.

About the Provider

The University of Caloocan City (UCC) is a local university established in 1971 that aims to provide educational opportunities for the indigent residents of Caloocan City. Its initial name was Caloocan City Community College which was later changed into Caloocan City Polytechnic College, offering 4-year courses in Industrial Education and Business Technology. The institution was finally elevated into its university status in 2004 through the Municipal Ordinance No. 0379.

Since its establishment, the university has made groundbreaking developments, expanding its programs with a number of courses available to the youth of Caloocan. Through the efforts of the local government to make quality education accessible to all, UCC is composed of 4 branches located in different parts of the city.

The University of Caloocan City has the College of Arts and Sciences, the College of Business and Accountancy, the College of Education, and the College of Law under its belt. It also has graduate degree programs namely, Doctor of Public Administration, Ph.D. Education Management, Master in Public Administration, Master in Business Administration, Master of Arts in Teaching in Early Grades, Master of Arts in Teaching Science, MAED-EM, and MS Criminology.
